posts.post_content:
Posted By: Richard Masson
The Photographic Baseball Cards of Goodwin & Co. (1886-1890)
by Joe Gonsowski, Jay Miller and Richard Masson

Copies still available. Beautiful hardcover with dust jacket, almost 500 full color pages, over 2500 photographs. 

send check for $125 to
Richard Masson
1158 26th Street #537
Santa Monica, CA  90403

Posted By: Bruce Kasarda
Richard, Jay and Co. I already have the book, but would like to say the book is absolutely fabulous. The photos, player information, and history are fascinating. The book is a must for any collector. Bruce Kasarda

Posted By: Jim
I received the book that was the prize in the Net54 contest.  I absolutely enjoyed this publication with its history of the cards and the numerous pictures.  I have only owned one OJ in my life and that was for only about 2 weeks.  As soon as I complete several sets that I am working on, I plan to start picking up some OJs.  The time period and the cards themselves are intriguing.  It is the era of baseball that I know least about, and I look forward to learning more about this period through the work of the dedicated authors of this fine resource and from the cards themselves.  Thanks to the authors, Leon, and Net54 for providing an opportunity for me to learn more about this long lost era of baseball history.  If you are a fan of Old Judge cards, this book is an absolute must.

Posted By: George L.
was there two of them??? I thought I was special Leon...guess not...LOL



George
